are adjacent coastal towns on the

On the Copper Coast, during the its mining heyday Moonta had a population second only to Adelaide in South Australia.

Today, the town plays on its Cornish heritage, mining tourism, as well as its beaches, boating and fishing.

value: name=Copper Coast Visitor Information Centre, Kadina
alt=The Farm Shed Museum & Tourism Centre

content=Moonta Mines Museum, Local and Family History Centre at the School of Mines, Hughes Engine House, Moonta Mines Tourist Railway (including Historic Horse Drawn Tram, Blacksmith Shop), Miners Cottage & Garden, Moonta Mines Sweet Shop, Richmans Engine House, Old Railway Station (Moonta Tourist Office).

content=Dress up like a miner and experience the wonder of the underground tunnels and cathedral like workings. Travel down to the 55 metre level. The hardworking miners of the 1800's pioneered these copper mines and have left us this legacy to enjoy at our leisure. Bookings are essential at the Moonta Information Centre.
, available at the Cornish Bakery, but also at many of the smaller cafes in town.
